catalyzed_reaction: Ring-opening of cyclohexene oxide with NaOCN to produce trans-hexahydro-2(3H)-benzoxazolone (trans-HBC).
formulation: Whole cell biocatalyst (wet cells) and cell lysate; used as harvested from E. coli BL21 (DE3) expression system.
name: Halohydrin dehalogenase HheG from Ilumatobacter coccineus (IcHheG)
plasmid_specifications: Gene codons optimized for E. coli BL21 expression system; subcloned into pET28a vector.
purification_method: No further purification; used as whole cells or cell lysate after lysozyme treatment.
special_treatment: For lysate catalysis, whole cells were pre-treated with lysozyme (1 g/L, 37°C, 1 hr) to obtain soluble enzyme. Reactions performed in two-phase system with ethyl acetate as co-solvent for high substrate loading. Reaction conditions: 50 g/L wet cell, 200 mM cyclohexene oxide, 400 mM NaOCN, 35% (v/v) ethyl acetate, pH 7.0–10.5, 25°C, 16–29 hrs. Pilot scale: 1.2 kg wet cell in 10 L reaction, 95% conversion, 87% isolated yield, 53% ee. No additional buffer required due to self-regulated pH by ethyl acetate hydrolysis.
